intro: Genista pulverulenta, commonly known as the dusty broom, is a low-growing shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch of color to its habitat. The plant has slender, branched stems covered in fine, grayish hairs, giving it a dusty appearance. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in pairs along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy environments.
